data.title: Love it. Good no-frills sushi option downtown.
data.text: Small place that seems family-run. Service was very attentive and the size and quality of the bento and maki was surprising considering the humble nature of this little restaurant.

data.title: Best sushi in Bellingham!
data.text: Fresh, made right before you, always delicious!  Outdoor patio and small indoor dining area.  Restrooms in adjacent building.

data.title: Very Small
data.text: Food was ok. Nothing really stood out. The place was very small and the tables were close together so there is no privacy.

data.title: Best sushi in town
data.text:
Been twice now.  The fish here is excellent.  The kitchen is tiny and orders are very slow.  The place is also very small if all the seats are filled it's very hard for the waitperson to get around.

They are VERY heavy handed with the mayo.  Hard to find many items without this fat laden distraction.  The fish is good enough, leave it alone.  Also, if you order a bento box ask for the (again with the mayo) dressing on the side.

Setting aside these couple of issues, they are very nice people, and I enjoyed it on both trips.  Come equipped with a few topics for conversation with your dinner companions, and nothing too personal as you'll be in your neighbors ear too.

data.title: Good food, but crowded seating
data.text: The food is very good.  I had sushi and my partner had a Bento.  We were both pleased with the food, but we had to ask for everything from water to a napkin.  They do charge for the green tea only serve 1/2 cup.  The service is poor because the server does not understand English and there was only one person serving.  The place is very small and unless you go at an odd hour (not a weekend night) the seating is very cramped and people kept bumping and pushing my chair.  Again, the food is good!

data.title: Outstanding value for the price!
data.text:
I very much enjoyed Jun's large, tasty, and fresh California rolls; and my dining partner enjoyed a Caterpillar roll with a very generous amount of avocado artfully draped over the eel.  Seriously, these rolls were twice the size of those that I have received in other restaurants, and the prices were at least 20% lower.  I would have given Jun's 5 stars if the kimchee that my dining partner also ordered had been as tasty as the rolls, and if the gyoza had not been fried just a little too hard.  My partner received a second bowl of miso soup without even asking and at no charge, which was a nice touch.

Jun's is a very small restaurant, but with clean and modern decor.  The lofty ceiling is higher than the restaurant is wide!  On our visit, a new server was still learning the ropes, but was friendly and welcoming.  

All in all, Jun's is definitely worth a return trip for the amazing sushi rolls.

data.title: Currently Best Sushi in Town (Jan 2016)
data.text:
Currently the best sushi place in Bellingham. One of our old favorites had been going downhill so we have gone through the sushi places again. This is currently the best in town.

Prices look high for the rolls but serving sizes are large, so under-order slightly and then order some more if you are still hungry.

We had two rolls, salmon nigiri shushi plus a bento box for lunch. That was too much unless you have a large appetite. The fish was fresh, firm, good texture and taste. Nothing had been stored too long. Everything was of very good quality.

Seating is very limited. Get there early.

data.title: Fresh Sushi Magic!
data.text:
This place knocked it OUT of the park! Fresh sushi does exist, it lives at Jun's Sushi. Mr. Park is the genuine article when it comes to sushi professionals. This is not a belt driven place.

Awesome!

G. Smith

data.title: Outstanding Sushi, Outstanding Service!
data.text:
Located in a little out-of-the-way spot that used to house a yogurt bar, Jun's Sushi is surprisingly doing a brisk business. Maybe that's due to the excellent, fresh, large sushi rolls that Jun makes. Maybe it's due to the affordable bento boxes. But the thing to know is: this place is *good*.

When Jun found out that I was vegan, and insisted on making me two rolls from scratch. He kept checking -- "No mayonnaise, right? Clear sauce okay?"

Everything super big, super fresh, great wakami (seaweed salad), fried tofu. The service is prompt, friendly and wonderful.  I'd go there happily any day!

data.title: Good Sushi in the middle of town
data.text:
Wanted a quick bite while in town before an appointment. Decided to try this place because we had a hankering for sushi made without a conveyor belt. service was friendly and quick. The owner was very personable and made us want to come back and try just his recommendations. 
Good flavor that needed no dipping in extra sauce. The green tea served only enhanced the artfully presented food. This place is a keeper......

data.title: Amazing Japanese Food at Reasonable Prices
data.text: The menu is full of amazing choices of nigiri sushi, specialty rolls, bentos, sashimi, tempura, and a variety of other Japanese dishes.  The service was outstanding.  The food was incredibly tasty and presented beautifully.  Three of us dined on bento and several sushi rolls, including beer, for less than $40. The manager came out and personally greeted us and asked if we enjoyed our meal.  It was a nice touch.  Highly recommend this Japanese restaurant!
